```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
library(flexdashboard)
library(plotly)
library(shiny)
library(readxl)
library(ggthemes)
library(scales)
library(here)
```

Improved Visual
=======================================================================

```{r import data, include=FALSE}

remote <- read_xlsx(here("data", "remote_work.xlsx"))

remote <- remote %>% 
  rename(
    time_period = `Time period`
  )

remote <- remote %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(`<29%`, `30-59%`, `>60%`),
    names_to = "bucket",
    values_to = "percentage"
  )


```

```{r}

remote %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = factor(time_period, levels = c("Before", "During", "After*"), ordered = TRUE), y = percentage, fill = factor(bucket, levels = c("<29%", "30-59%", ">60%"), ordered = TRUE)), width = 0.6) +
  labs(
    title = "Executives are Embracing Work-From-Home During COVID-19",
    subtitle = "Showing the % of executives that expect remote employees",
    x = element_blank(),
    y = element_blank(),
    fill = "% of Remote Employees",
    caption = "Source: PwC U.S Remote Work Survey, June 25, 2020. Base: 120 U.S. executives. * = projected"
  ) +
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "Avenir"),
    plot.background = element_blank(),
    panel.background = element_blank(),
    axis.text.y = element_blank(),
    axis.ticks = element_blank(), 
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12, vjust = 0),
    # axis.title.x = element_text(hjust = 1), # to left justify the title
    # axis.title.y = element_text(hjust = 1), # to top justify the horizontal title
    plot.caption = element_text(size = 6),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    plot.title = element_text(margin = margin(0,0,0,0)),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(margin = margin(0,0,20,0))
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("grey80", "lightblue", "royalblue")) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(.50, 1), labels = scales::percent_format(), expand = c(0,0)) + # expand moves the graph closer to labels
  # geom_text(x = 1.01, y = .35, label = "39%", color = "lightblue", size = 5) + # annotate is better
  # geom_text(x = 2.01, y = .73, label = "77%", color = "lightblue", size = 5) +
  # geom_text(x = 3.01, y = .51, label = "55%", color = "lightblue", size = 5) +
  annotate("text", x = 1.01, y = .35, label = "39%", color = "lightblue", size = 5, family = "Avenir") +
  annotate("text", x = 2.01, y = .73, label = "77%", color = "lightblue", size = 5, family = "Avenir") +
  annotate("text", x = 3.01, y = .51, label = "55%", color = "lightblue", size = 5, family = "Avenir") +
  annotate("segment", x = 1.3, xend = 2.7, y = .35, yend = .51, arrow = arrow(type = "open")) +
  coord_cartesian(clip = "off") # doesn't crop your texts outside the plot
  

```
